title: How to Make Pindang Patin (Pindang Catfish)

steps.headline: Wash the catfish (Patin), cut it into 3-4 parts or as you want.
steps.description: Give lemons to blotting out putrid taste from the fish. Leave it around 10-15 minutes.

steps.headline: Mashed all the ingredients that should be mashed.
Heat the oil in the frying pan.
steps.description: Put all the seasoning that has been mashed. Let the ingredients cooked and changed the color.

steps.headline: Put the water in, wait until boil.
steps.description: Then, put also all the last ingredients like bay leaves,  galangal, lemongrass, salt, and sugar.

steps.headline: Put the catfish into it; cook it 15 – 20 minutes until the fish is cooked.
steps.description: Then, in the last minutes put in the tomatoes and the pineapple.

steps.headline: Serve it on the bowl, give basil on the top.

text: Wash the catfish (Patin), cut it into 3-4 parts or as you want. Give lemons to blotting out putrid taste from the fish. Leave it around 10-15 minutes. Mashed all the ingredients that should be mashed.  Heat the oil in the frying pan. Put all the seasoning that has been mashed. Let the ingredients cooked and changed the color. Put the water in, wait until boil. Then, put also all the last ingredients like bay leaves,  galangal, lemongrass, salt, and sugar. Put the catfish into it; cook it 15 – 20 minutes until the fish is cooked. Then, in the last minutes put in the tomatoes and the pineapple. Serve it on the bowl, give basil on the top.
